tddt

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • tddt.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the controller class for the main stage.
    Version:
    unknown
    Author:
    Dominik Kuhnen

      • Controller

        public Controller()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        This method initializes some objects and disables the test textarea and the next step button.

      • newTask

        public void newTask()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Open Catalog chooser window, prepare main window for user interaction. Program supports only 1 class / test per exercise for now. XML-Loader supports multiple classes per exercise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • turnBabystepsOn

        public void turnBabystepsOn()
        Creates a new Thread for babysteps. Checks for changes each second.

      • turnBabystepsOff

        public void turnBabystepsOff()
        Interrupts the babysteps thread and sets babysteps to disabled.

      • setBabystepsTime

        public void setBabystepsTime()
        Opens a window in which the user can enter a new babysteps time. Input can be between 1 and 180 seconds.

      • showTrackingChart

        public void showTrackingChart()
        Opens a new window in which the TrackingChart is shown.
        See Also:
        The TrackingChart implementation.

      • showTrackerLog

        public void showTrackerLog()
        Opens a new window in which the tracking log is shown.
        See Also:
        The Tracker implementation.

      • onNewExerciseClicked

        public void onNewExerciseClicked()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Opens a new stage in which the CatalogEditor is shown.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the FXML for the CatalogEditor stage is corrupt.
        See Also:
        The CatalogEditor implementation.

      • nextPhase

        public void nextPhase()
        This method switches the program into the next TDD phase if the entered code meets the requirements. Each time the Phase is switched a new backup and a new tracker dump is created.

      • prevPhase

        public void prevPhase()
        Switches the program into the previous phase. Can only happen while in phase 1.

      • checkTest

        private boolean checkTest()
        Checks if the test is compilable.
        Returns:
        True if test is compilable. Otherwise false.

      • checkCodeAndTest

        private boolean checkCodeAndTest()
        Returns:
        True if code and test are compilable

      • checkIfCompilableClass

        private boolean checkIfCompilableClass(java.lang.String code)
        Checks if the code meets the minimum requirements of a Java class.
        Parameters:
        code - The code that's checked.
        Returns:
        True if the code meets the requirements.

      • updateGUIElements

        private void updateGUIElements(Phase phase)
        Updates the GUI elements to the new phases' requirements.
        Parameters:
        phase - The new phase.
